title: ‘Modern Warfare II’ multiplayer is mostly more of the same. That’s okay.
description: “Modern Warfare 2” adds new mechanics, gunsmith options, game modes and polish. It has also removed some controversial mechanics, chiefly slide-canceling.

title: Meet the 14 Pokémon with the most disturbing backstories
description: With "Pokémon Violet" and "Scarlet" right around the corner — with Greavard in tow — we've compiled the scariest Pokédex entries so far.

title: Russia threatens commercial satellites that Pentagon sees as its future
description: In a speech at the United Nations, a Russian official said the proliferation of privately operated satellites is “an extremely dangerous trend that goes beyond the harmless use of outer-space technologies and has become apparent during the latest developments in Ukraine.”

title: Video game franchises we want raised from the dead
description: Remake them, remaster them, reboot them — just please resurrect these great games.

title: Twitter privacy settings to change now
description: Your tweets may be public, but you can still have more privacy on the social media service.

title: Racist tweets quickly surfaced after Musk closed Twitter deal
description: A wide range of anonymous Twitter accounts celebrated Musk’s takeover and argued it meant the old rules against bigotry no longer applied.

title: Live updates: Elon Musk takes control of Twitter
description: The acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk started in April and closed Thursday. Musk has made many claims as to his plans for the social media company.

title: That customer service number? It could be a scam.
description: Before you call a customer service number -- especially one connected to a payment app like PayPal -- take these steps to make sure you're not talking to a fraudster.

title: Elon Musk bought Twitter. Now what?
description: Elon Musk already changed his Twitter bio to "Chief Twit." Find out his reason for buying, and what other changes may be coming to the company upon acquisition.

title: The Washington Post tried to get suppressed on TikTok. Here’s what happened.
description: Our reporters tried to get TikTok to punish The Washington Post's TikTok account and keep viewers from watching it by posting content the app suppresses.

title: As Washington wavers on TikTok, Beijing exerts control
description: TikTok’s link to China has sparked fears over propaganda and privacy. It’s also exposed America’s failure to safeguard the web.
